website_summaries.verdict: This low-profile, compact case keeps your binoculars close to your body, so they don't snag on branches while you're out in the woods.
pros: Adjustable flap lets you hold many different types of binoculars
Universal straps let you attach to a belt, vest or pack
Measures 8 inches by 6.5 inches by 1.5 inches
Build-in drawstring bag for extra protection
cons: Actual carrying space is smaller than measurements given, so measure carefully

customer_reviews.title: Giant Velcro patch is loud to open and it's a lot smaller than you think
customer_reviews.text: Update: after removing the inner pull string flap and Velcro patches my binoculars fit. They're a bit snug but now I don't need to buy a second pouch. Much happier after the modifications. Doesn't fit my Leupold Yosemite 8x30 binoculars, I've tried vertical and horizontal orientation. Nice pouch other than that but I can do without the gigantic Velcro closure for my purpose. For the price I'll probably remove the Velcro and get a small pair of binos that fit in it.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Well-made, excellent protection for binoculars.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my Zeiss 10x40 binoculars because the thin case that that came in wore out. This case is well padded and the binoculars fit perfectly. I feel like my binoculars finally have a decent case. I love the fact that they have straps in the back that slip right on to the belt of a fanny pack I use when I go bird watching, so they make the whole thing essentially hands-free and I can use the binoculars with ease. The case is heavy-duty and seems very well made. Frankly, I feel like it is the kind of case my binoculars SHOULD have come in to begin with. It is the best protection I've found for them.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Goebel Padgett

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, but small and awkward
customer_reviews.text: Bag is very tough and made out of quality material, but is too small. I can barely fit my 8x42 binoculars, especially with the sleeve inside. Pulling out your binos is like turning a sock inside out. Plus there's a large piece of velcro to close the flap. Good for securely closing flap, but there's already a clip there for that, so it's a bit superfluous. Plus it's really loud to open, so is no bueno for hunting.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb L.

customer_reviews.title: Nice binocular pouch.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well constructed pouch. It fit my Steiner 8x30 Mil/Marine binoculars perfectly. They had to be folded down and placed in sideways, but they fit and come back out easily. The flap is secured by Velcro and plastic buckle...it’s not opening by accident. There is a drawstring closure for the binocular compartment also, looks to be rain proof. The molle straps to attach it are nice and rigid, they have press button snaps, which hold well. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M

customer_reviews.title: Very nice with slight modifications.
customer_reviews.text: Time will tell as far as overall durability. My first impression is good. They fit my nikon 7s 8x30 binocs perfect. I can see how some 42mm models could be snug. I agree with some users about the velcro being unnecessary. I used a hobby torch and carefully melted both sides of velcro so its silent. The clip closure is more than adequate alone. I also trimmed out the drawstring pouch. Also not necessary.
customer_reviews.author: riverplayer

customer_reviews.title: Fits Vortex Diamondback
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made, paded case for your binoculars. I have Vortex Diamondback 10x44. I think it also fits Vortex 10x42 Fury rangefinder binoculars (my next buy). The color is ranger green with molle on the back, strap snaps, a pull out cover with draw string. Fits on my molle harness used for long treks up the mountain style 1 mile range.
customer_reviews.author: R. Peters

customer_reviews.title: but it's not easy getting them in and out due to the tight ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of old school 6x30 Sears 1960s Japanese-made binoculars. The faux leather case that came with them finally disintegrated, so I bough this case. The binoculars are too wide to fit into it length-wise. I finally got them in the case sideways, but it's not easy getting them in and out due to the tight fit. The case is well-made and should be okay for smaller, modern binoculars, but, it's hardly "tactical." It uses Velcro and a plastic buckle to keep the flap closed. When you open the flap, the Velcro makes a lot of noise.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: NOT A BINO CASE
customer_reviews.text: I would not call this s Bionocular case. I have a pair of Lepuoid Yosemite compact. The won't fit in the case. The Velcro on the case locks tight and makes a lot of noise opening. The top has a quick release latch but it is redundant considering the Velcro locks so tight. Over all the case is built tank tough and extremely sturdy. For the price of $16 it is well worth the money and I will keep it for other uses just not a Bino case.
customer_reviews.author: Lm Nash

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid quality
customer_reviews.text: I returned this simply because it didn't fit the binoculars I was looking to carry. I read a review that said this was low quality. Ridiculous. This thing is rock solid. I almost kept it because it is bomber. Just didn't see using it. I'm a little amazed that the quality is so high for the price. If it fit my binocs, I'd have happily paid $50 vs. the $15 it goes for. Pull the trigger if this meets your needs. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Improved replacement case for lost original binocular case.
customer_reviews.text: Fits Nikon Monarch ATB 10x40 Binoculars perfectly. Original case kept falling off because the small patch of velcro was worn out. This case has a generous amount of velcro, and a buckle as a back up to keep the case close when travelling. Love the MOLLE webbing on and the extra padding in this case. Price point was very reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Robinson J Jr

customer_reviews.title: Not tactical at all
customer_reviews.text: This is a well built product but not very well thought out at all. There is a huge piece of velcro on the front flap, as if the clip wasn't good enough. This piece of velcro is noisy. Opening this will alert every deer within 100 yards. Decent well built with molle mounting, but not tactical at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... wide angle and my 9 x 30 Nikon very nicely. Adds small extra bulk to the binoculars
customer_reviews.text: Fits my 7 x 35 wide angle and my 9 x 30 Nikon very nicely. Adds small extra bulk to the binoculars. I would have prefered a different arrangement for attaching a strap to the case, tho. It does not have as an option the usual rings to which one can attach a strap. But this isn't a big problem, since most people don't carry binoculars around their neck IN the case... the case is just for protecting the binoculars in a pack or otherwise in secondary storage as one brings them TO the area where one will carry them ready for use.
customer_reviews.author: Martin H. Goodman

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: Much smaller then stated. Measured my binoculars before ordering. They were slightly under the size listed. Could not get the small end in the case. They must press it under a hydraulic press (10,000 lbs) then measure it. It was about an inch smaller on all measurements. I can use it to carry about a dozen 12 ga shells.
customer_reviews.author: Gerard McLin

customer_reviews.title: Great case for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice case with soft lining and draw string cover to protect your binoculars. Top flap with Velcro and adjustable clip lets you fit a wide range of binoculars but a perfect fit for my 10x42 Zeiss
customer_reviews.author: CRS

customer_reviews.title: Good case but noisy on opening.
customer_reviews.text: Well made case that fits my 10X42 optics well. Gave 4 stars because of design. Velcro/snap closure is redundant. Velcro is noisy in hunting situations ( imagine it in a stealthy tactical situation). This was not mentioned in product description. Otherwise a good bino. case.
customer_reviews.author: David G.

customer_reviews.title: Good Case
customer_reviews.text: The case is nice. There's not much flexibility so the size they list is the size. I had an older pair of binoculars that were roughly the same size as the case. I figured they would fit no problem with the case being made out of cloth material. I have to put my binoculars inside the case sideways and it's a very tight fit. That's on me though. As long as your binoculars are a smaller size this is a good case to keep them clean.
customer_reviews.author: Dave G.

customer_reviews.title: Everything about this case is great except the hook and loop fastener on the flap
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this case is great except the hook and loop fastener on the flap. I use this case for my Vortex Diamondback 10x42 binoculars and they could not fit any better. I have the case attached to the outside of an Eberlestock Low Drag pack. It makes for an efficient means of carrying my binos to and from our FFPs. The hook and loop is LOUD when opening in hunting situation. I rendered it useless and silent by melting it with a heat gun. That little one minute modification made this the perfect bino case for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: John in Texas

customer_reviews.title: This was best thing I could find so I would recommend to ...
customer_reviews.text: Awfully haRd to find a padded binoculars cases that is molle compatible, wish this was a little bigger, it fits vortex diamondback 10x42 but fit is tight and it takes a little to get them out of case. This was best thing I could find so I would recommend to others, especially at this price
customer_reviews.author: HuntrFishr

customer_reviews.title: Fits Vortex Diamondback 10x42
customer_reviews.text: Fits Vortex Diamondback 10x42 (Gen II, model DB-205) perfectly, not too tight and not too sloppy. Love the Vortex binoculars but the included case was flimsy and over sized. I paid less than $15 for the ODG model which is an excellent value. Like other Voo Doo products, the quality is solid and probably the best value out there.
customer_reviews.author: RCC

customer_reviews.title: Great little case
customer_reviews.text: Great little case. Too small for my Vortex Optics CF-4303 Crossfire 10x50 Binocular, but still a great case. Not deep enough. The velcro on the flap didn't meet the velcro on the front of the case when my binoculars were inside.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin M.

customer_reviews.title: High quality binocular case.
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of 10x42mm binoculars and this case fits well. I plan on making a couple small modifications. I don't have a need for the thin nylon piece with the draw lock around it. I going to cut this out. I would prefer a non-velcro closure for a hunting system, velcro is just too noisy for hunting. I'm using this on a belt with a longer than standard neck strap for the binoculars and wear it around just one shoulder. The case is high quality and looks like it should hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Pankonin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for my Vortex Diamondbacks. My only complaint is that there's no strap. That was easily remedied with another purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis J. Rooney

customer_reviews.title: Very good.
customer_reviews.text: Good solid and well made. Very functional and durable. A pair of medium binoculars fits great. Smaller models will fit but they will bounce around unless you stuff a pair of gloves or something else that fill up the extra space.
customer_reviews.author: JDRanger

customer_reviews.title: Well built. Too noisy for hunting.
customer_reviews.text: Very well built. Protects my binoculars well. But, way too much Velcro. It is the noisiest thing in my bag and hard to get my binoculars in and out of. I am going to buy something else to use for my binoculars and use this for protecting things while traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Leann Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Case
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy and well built case. The Velcro on the flap is strong and won't open easily, which is good. I found the rainguard sleeve to get in the way and cut it out. This case was bought for a pair of Nikon Monarch 5 10x42 binos. It's a tight fit for them! The case interior dimensions are smaller than their description leads you to believe. I don't think it would be possible to fit a 50mm objective lens binocs in this case.
customer_reviews.author: Smoothie2589

customer_reviews.title: Actual measurements not even close to description..... super lame
customer_reviews.text: Not even close to the measurements given. Over an inch less than posted. SAYS its 7”x6”x3” and it ACTUALLY measures 5”x 6” x 2-ish “.... completely lame. These folks should check their descriptions before posting things. Completely lame
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdily constructed
customer_reviews.text: Wish my gear in Nam had been this good ☺
customer_reviews.author: Tiger 56 Alpha

customer_reviews.title: Nice quailty for the price, but runs small
customer_reviews.text: I measured my Steiner Predator binocs very carefully before ordering this case. Acording to the dimensions in the product description, my binocs should have fit, but they did not. I sent it back. I think it is slightly smaller than advertised.
customer_reviews.author: The Erstwhile Photographer

customer_reviews.title: Fits my Vortex 8x42s
customer_reviews.text: A perfect fit for my Vortex diamondback 8x42 binos. The OEM vortex case was ginormous and VooDoo fits!
customer_reviews.author: TrafficMan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy construction, tight fit for porro prism binoculars.
customer_reviews.text: This case is very nice. It uses both a buckle and velcro to secure the flap, and inside is a drawstring enclosure to help keep water and dust out. The construction is top notch.It is a very snug fit for my Nikon 8244 ACULON A211 7x35 Binoculars, so keep that in mind if you want easy, quick access. It would likely be a better case for roof prism glasses, but that isn't the fault of the case.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Zeiss Terra ED 10x42s
customer_reviews.text: Nice snug fit for my Zeiss Terra ED 10x42s NOT for medium or large binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, quiet zippers, very well made. Velcro is a bit loud for hunting but pouch is great.
customer_reviews.author: RidingtheDance

customer_reviews.title: If only the logo was a velcro patch.
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality. Binocular bags dont seem very complex but this one is well thought through.
customer_reviews.author: UNKNOWN

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Great for travel but don't expect to hunt with this case. The Velcro is loud, but you can cover it with a patch. I keep my binoculars in this while they are in my backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for hiking or camping. Do not buy for hunting.
customer_reviews.text: Good case for a small to medium sized pair of binoculars. However I do not recommend this product for hunting because of the velcro. Opening the case could alert game of your presence and spoil your hunt / chances to get a shot off.
customer_reviews.author: Contagion

customer_reviews.title: They fit perfect with a little room left for the strap to ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Nikon 12x42 Monarch 3 binos. They fit perfect with a little room left for the strap to stay attached. The case is good canvas quality. Really like this case.
customer_reviews.author: Tom J.

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: A very useful shape for more than just binoculars. I also like the fact there is a retaining snap as well as Velcro. Its heavily padded.
customer_reviews.author: Happy

customer_reviews.title: Solid case for your binoculars.
customer_reviews.text: Well built case for my Steiner binoculars. As in previous reviews, the can be a little tight depending on your opticts but for mine, it works fine. The only issue I have is, I need to take the neck strap off to get it to close. Not a big deal for me, though. Overal, I'm very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Seedawg

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient.
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of hiking and use this for binoculars. I would rather have the Binoculars in this case then around my neck. It is well made and access is simple.
customer_reviews.author: Owen Parker Jr.

customer_reviews.title: ... all year long rain or shine and it works great.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it for 2 years now while working in the woods all year long rain or shine and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: DaveO

customer_reviews.title: A decent case but the velcro is just too much ...
customer_reviews.text: A decent case but the velcro is just too much and and overkill. It is very noisy to to just open the flaps to get the bino out. What it does is it offers a full protection when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Mad Max

customer_reviews.title: this is a great product except it's really tight on a Nikon Pro ...
customer_reviews.text: this is a great product except it's really tight on a Nikon Pro staff 7 otherwise it is very sturdy and well built it may finished pair of binoculars that are smaller
customer_reviews.author: dale

customer_reviews.title: I have 3 of these and need a couple more.
customer_reviews.text: I love these things for binoculars or anything you don't want rattling arund. They are a little snug for some binos.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Cockerell

customer_reviews.title: Dang tight on my Armored Bushnell x40, they need ...
customer_reviews.text: Dang tight on my Armored Bushnell x40, they need to be wider, as most binoculars have a limited ability to collapse. The rain cover and flap allowed me put mine in vertically rather than front first.
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD H HANSEN JR

customer_reviews.title: Case too narrow
customer_reviews.text: This would be a nice case if my binoculars would fit. My Optex 10x50 are as wide as this case is long and there is no way they will fit. I can't find any case larger so this will have to be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Tematua

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely pleased with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: We bought a premium pair of binoculars at an estate sale that came without a case. This case fits perfectly and provides more protection than the original case ever would have. Absolutely pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A. J. Kohler

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: many great uses..binoculars, camera or just a hiking belt pack or biking
customer_reviews.author: darli

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: The good quality case I got with my binoculars were a pain to get my binocs in and out of so got this case and it works great. I use the binoc straps to carry them in the case.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Cyd

customer_reviews.title: Kind of bulky, but protective indeed
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I needed a real space to put my binoculars. Mine are almost too small for this pouch, or perhaps the pouch is simply very large. I get the feeling that no harm can come to anything that rests in the pouch. That's what I want.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Says it is great.
customer_reviews.text: Present for son, who chose it above others. Says it is great.
customer_reviews.author: Curt

customer_reviews.title: Overall I am very happy with this case
customer_reviews.text: I bought this case for a new pair of Zeiss Terra ED 524406 binoculars. I measured the binoculars in all dimensions before ordering the case and the binoculars fit perfectly. The case is well padded and includes an inner drawstring liner for added shock resistance. Overall I am very happy with this case.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Used for Vortex 10x32 binos
customer_reviews.text: I use this for a pair of Vortex 10x32 binos. They just fit. I'm not sure it would fit any larger. The sleeve seems a little excessive, but overall I like them a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Justin B.

customer_reviews.title: Great case
customer_reviews.text: Nice case, but had to return the binoculars to Canon. I'll get another pair, and the case will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: William A. Emmett

customer_reviews.title: Great protection, but pretty tight
customer_reviews.text: This case does a great job of securing and protecting my binoculars, but if I ever need to get them out in a big hurry I'll be out of luck - this case is very tight and it takes a bit of work to get them in an out.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Measure first.
customer_reviews.text: My fault I didn’t measure my binoculars before ordering, so case was too small. Although, had I seen it in person in a larger size I may not have purchased it because it didn’t seem sturdy enough.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Tactical heavy duty Quality...5 stars
customer_reviews.text: I keep my Bose blue tooth speaker in it And it is a perfect , snug , fit
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J Doxey

customer_reviews.title: Customer satisfaction
customer_reviews.text: Neat pouch, but it is a little small for 10x50 binos.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Binocular case
customer_reviews.text: The binocular case was exactly what I expected. I feel it’s a great value for the amount paid!
customer_reviews.author: Marcia H

customer_reviews.title: Its good quality made but the advertised size is off by ...
customer_reviews.text: Its good quality made but the advertised size is off by 1/2 inch for the width. Its only 5 1/2 inches wide but is advertised at 6 inches.
customer_reviews.author: REWB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit !
customer_reviews.text: Nice case, fits my Canon 12 x 36 image stabilizers perfect, much more protection then the case that comes with them!
customer_reviews.author: JCG

customer_reviews.title: Great Products
customer_reviews.text: I own two of these products. One carries my binoculars and the other carries my camera while backpacking. Very well built and protective of expensive equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Vancergk

customer_reviews.title: Defective Velcro flap
customer_reviews.text: I only discovered the problem after one use of this product. I tried to return but Amazon says it's too late. I only had a chance to use it after a month and I guess I just missed the return. You can see that the Velcro has failed in the photo. My Vortex 10x42 fits nicely so it did not stress it. The Velcro is really strong but the sewing is bad.
customer_reviews.author: GSM

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fits my 8x40 bincoculars perfectly. Wish it had a shoulder strap.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Bilodeau

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Great item and fit my binoculars perfectly. Quicker delivery than expected as well. I like the fact that it is MOLLE compatible and works well with my rucksack.
customer_reviews.author: Rick T.

customer_reviews.title: Good case. Has a nylon sleeve on the inside ...
customer_reviews.text: Good case. Has a nylon sleeve on the inside to help keep the crap out of case. I carry my binocs. in a backpack but if you are carrying other ways you may want to purchase a strap.
customer_reviews.author: Nivlac 531

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Lightly padded and has a drawstring water-proof pouch integrated to keep your binos dry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nicely made case.
customer_reviews.text: Although it's made in China it's still a very good quality bino case. It fits my Leopold Mojave bx-3's perfectly. Nicely padded and it won't open on its own thanks to the outside buckle and large velcro patch on the back of the flap. Only giving it 4 stars because it's Chinese made.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Velcro came loose from flap
customer_reviews.text: After about 5 months, the velcro separated from the flap. There is another comment with an attached picture of the same failure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Great product; versatile attachment options; great price and on-time delivery.
customer_reviews.author: William Harris

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great case. Perfect fit and durable. Much better than factory cases.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good binocular bag. 8x 30 steiner binoculars fit, but snug
customer_reviews.author: John Hext

customer_reviews.title: Great case! Its padded inside and has a top ...
customer_reviews.text: Great case ! Its padded inside and has a top drawstring with snap lock !
customer_reviews.author: Tito

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: but the bushnell binoculars I purchased came with one, so I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but not really practical
customer_reviews.text: The case protects my binoculars but it is too big and you can't really store anything else in it. A strap rather than the 3 loop holes would have been more usefull
customer_reviews.author: Marcia A

customer_reviews.title: You have some case!
customer_reviews.text: A well engineered and constructed case, it fit my 8 x 30's like hand in glove.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard T. Muscato

customer_reviews.title: On the small side.
customer_reviews.text: Not exactly what I expected. Apparently they make a couple different sizes. This one is too small for anything other than compact binoculars. Mine are pretty small but I had to put them on their side to squeeze them in. Overall it is a durable Molle pouch and I’m sure I will find another use for it but definitely ordering a different one for my binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: Jess McKellar

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This carrier was better than I expected! The inside is soft for protecting an expensive pair of binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: N. J. Stone

customer_reviews.title: Great case, my binoculars fit in it fine
customer_reviews.text: Great case , my binoculars fit in it fine , very well made case.
customer_reviews.author: Herbert Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Super nice!
customer_reviews.text: Well made, flexible in terms of accepting different sizes of binoculars. Outside seems very durable and the inside has much protection for lenses. I'm impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Dave U.

customer_reviews.title: Voodoo Tactical???
customer_reviews.text: Very shoddy. Did any else mention that a skull and "voodoo tactical" are sewn into the front flap of this binocular case, or that it pokes out this way and that because of the poor quality of its construction. But, if you are looking for something "tactical" and not too expensive for an 8-10 year old boy this would be perfect. Meanwhile, what to do with this thing? It probably will cost as much to ship it back as the product itself cost. Salvation!
customer_reviews.author: Eliza

customer_reviews.title: perfect size
customer_reviews.text: great quality. using it for my hunting binoculars and attached to my molle blaze orange vest. One concern the clip is good enough but it also has a large peice of velcro under the flap. for me, I removed because It makes a lot of noise when i open it when I am hunting when i need to be as quiet as possible. not a big issue.
customer_reviews.author: dan delarosbil

customer_reviews.title: Execllent case
customer_reviews.text: This is a execellent case for binoculars. Well made and nice looking. The only things is I ordered it and wanted it for a childs pair of binoculars. It was to nice for them and I should have know better. I tried to figure where I could use it but had to return it. So sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Dobea

customer_reviews.title: size for binocular case
customer_reviews.text: Although the size was clearly on the information I thought maybe it would stretch or something for binoculars. As it is I have no use for a carrying case for opera glasses. Jim Sharp
customer_reviews.author: James L. Sharp

product_meta.title: VooDoo Tactical Men's Tactical Binocular Case
product_meta.description:
You will never have to dig through your pack looking for your binoculars again when you carry them close at hand in this Voodoo Tactical padded binocular case. Just strap it to your MOLLE compatible tactical vest, chest rig, plate carrier or even your rifle bag. 

The pouch is adjustable to fit a variety of styles, including Steiner. We've tested them with a range of 35 to 50 mm objective lenses in the 6x to 8x range. But to be safe, measure your pair. The exterior dimensions of this case are 7" tall by 6" wide with 3" depth. The cover will adjust to give a little more height if necessary.

This listing is for a pouch.
feature_bullets: Allows you to carry different types of binoculars
Attached to belt, vest or Pack with Universal straps

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
